titleStmt.title: A perfect relation of the taking of Leicester: with the severall marches of the Kings army since the taking thereof. Colonell Hastings being made the governour. With the state of the town at this present. And how they plunder the countrey. Also, how Northampton horse skirmished with the Kings, and what losse on both sides. With the condition of both armies, and their severall rendezvouz fully made known. Published by authority.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for Iohn Wright at the signe of the Kings-head in the Old-baily.,

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
